meanings.definition: A very small amount or quantity
meanings.sent1: She only had a few jots of paint left for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a jot of salt to the soup to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse left jots of footprints all over the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent4: The stars twinkled like jots of light in the dark night sky.
meanings.sent5: His kindness was like a jot of warmth in the cold room.

meanings.definition: To write or make a brief note of something
meanings.sent1: He quickly jots down the important points during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She jots a reminder on the sticky note to buy groceries.
meanings.sent3: The detective jots clues in his notebook to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent4: She jots her dreams on paper, hoping they come true one day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher jots feedback on the student's essay for improvement.
